title: Dalton Dobkins: 17-year-old boy killed in Wellington shooting identified
content:
Autoplay:Vigil for teen shot to death in homeCONNECTING...X17-year-old found shot to death
WELLINGTON, Fla. - UPDATE: The sheriff's office has identified the victim as Dalton Dobkins and say they are investigating the death as a homicide.
Dozens of friends gathered for a candlelight vigil near Dalton's home Wednesday night. They say Dalton loved to fish and was preparing to go to the U.S. Marin Corps Boot Camp in the summer.
--------------------------------------
17 year old Dalton Dobkins was murdered this morning in Wellington and someone knows what happened. Do the right thing. Please come forward. pic.twitter.com/Ha88dIcXP5
— PBSO (@PBCountySheriff) December 1, 2016
The Palm Beach County Sheriff's Office is investigating a fatal shooting early Wednesday morning in Wellington.
At 3:36 a.m., deputies responded to a report of a shooting at the Estates at Wellington Green, a gated community located in the 2300 block of Stonybrook Drive.
Loading video...
When deputies arrived, they found a 17-year-old boy dead at the scene. No motive or suspect info is known at this time.
Detectives are at the scene investigating.
As the sun comes up pictures from a early morning deadly shooting in Wellington at Stonybrook drive Wellington green Estates PBSO on scene pic.twitter.com/q0jhv5qMxS
— Johann Hoffend (@Chopper5WPTV) November 30, 2016
Kids boarding the bus for school outside neighborhood where one man was found dead after early morning shooting in Wellington. @WPTV #amcrew pic.twitter.com/88Bz1xWQAp
— Stephanie Susskind (@StephanieWPTV) November 30, 2016
